candidates.name: Anita Baker
candidates.why_elect: I am born and bred in Porirua I am known for getting things done with a good community profile. I work locally and contribute to the community in a variety of ways and forums. I am experienced in running council committees and have good strategic and financial management skills.
candidates.why_stand: I want to see improved performance from the council and transformation of Porirua into a more attractive and engaging city. We need more progress on improving our natural environment. The city is experiencing solid growth and I want to see our basic services are fit for purpose.

candidates.name: Brett Crombie
candidates.why_elect: As a Chartered Accountant I'll serve our community by running the ruler over council spend and putting forward the tough financial questions on behalf of all ratepayers and residents.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing to serve the hard-working residents of Porirua who are fed up with our council's frivolous attitude to money. With common sense and financial responsibility we can create a vibrant, sustainable, growing city which appeals to families, business owners and retirees.

candidates.name: Rabeea Inayatullah
candidates.why_elect: I am born and raised in Papakowhai and spent my primary and secondary days in Porirua. But, I truly care for our local residents and communities. I have always been genuine, authentic, transparent and teachable. I believe it is these characteristics which will make me a good elected representative.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I want to represent the Rangatahi of Porirua and provide a platform for them at this decision making level. Also, I want to empower young woman and be a role-model for them as growing up I couldn't relate to many of my inspirations.

candidates.name: Ross Leggett
candidates.why_elect: I grew up in Porirua—4 generations of our family live here. I have a background at senior level in infrastructure management and have contributed strongly to this area during the term of the current council. There are major challenges ahead which I would like the opportunity to address.
candidates.why_stand: Porirua has a jewel in the crown—its harbour which is something we must protect, improve and enjoy more. Our diversity also makes us stronger and unique. This is something to be proud of.

candidates.name: Iain Maclean
candidates.why_elect: I've lived in Pukerua Bay for 30 years and have been involved in many community groups here. I've been chair of the Residents Association for the past nine years. I have a record of leadership, influence and community advocacy, and work well with others to find lasting solutions to problems.
candidates.why_stand: Porirua's population is expected to increase by 50% in the next 25-30 years. I want to be a strong, local, independent voice in the area most affected by large residential developments. Growth will create opportunities for Porirua, but we must manage its financial, social and environmental impacts well.

candidates.name: Josh Trlin
candidates.why_elect: I'm a law and commerce graduate working at a leading law firm in Wellington. I hope to use the skills I have gained through my study and work to give back to our community. I'm proud of and passionate about this city—Porirua is, and always will be, home.
candidates.why_stand: I'm standing for Porirua's Northern Ward because the issues that face our community are too urgent to wait. Far too often the most difficult problems are set aside in the too-hard basket. Issues like the climate, housing, and mental health crises need meaningful action right now.

candidates.name: Nathan Waddle
candidates.why_elect: As a committee member of the Whitby Residents Association and working full time at New World, I am in front of the people and get a great understanding of what is going on.
candidates.why_stand: As a proud Porirua resident, I want to Provide a fresh balanced voice for the people of the Northern Ward, while working with the ratepayers to better understand what they want their money spent on.

candidates.name: Beverley Anne Wakem
candidates.why_elect: The range of experience I bring to the table is immense. I've held key roles in national and international entities, and managed large enterprises. My whole career has been grounded in service to the public—it's in my DNA. I'm about social justice and fairness for all.
candidates.why_stand: I believe Porirua is rapidly rising above a previously poor image—from "P Town", to "Boomtown." We still have some way to go and I want to be part of that—revitalising the city and having it acknowledged as key player in the region.
